alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 8:20PM MST until July 31 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN PIMA COUNTY... At 820 PM MST, The heavy rainfall from thunderstorms earlier this afternoon had ended, but several areas across the greater Tucson metro and Catalina Foothills continued to experience flooding late this evening. Please heed road closures and avoid driving into flooded streets. Another flash flood warning remains in effect from the Finger Rock wash in the Catalina Foothills until 1015 PM MST. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of normally dry washes and ponding of water in low lying spots and city streets. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... the greater Tucson metro area, Tanque Verde, Vail, Saguaro National Park East, Sabino Canyon Recreation Area, and Catalina Foothills. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
